results.title: Bsss
results.brief_description: A fly meets an elephant…by the book! A fly buzzes around a room landing upon a book with pictures of an elephant inside. The fly appears to investigate the drawing. A human squashes the fly into the book. Fly and elephant are united. (Screened at MISAF, October 2000.)
results.description: A fly meets an elephant…by the book! A fly buzzes around a room landing upon a book with pictures of an elephant inside. The fly appears to investigate the drawing. A human squashes the fly into the book. Fly and elephant are united. (Screened at MISAF, October 2000.)

results.title: Lazy Sunday afternoon
results.brief_description: In the desert a vulture enjoys the silence of a hot afternoon. The sudden appearance of a vehicle destroys the quiet of the day. Two pistoleros exit the car ready for a duel; our hero, the vulture, watches as the pistoleros take part in a very funny slow motion shoot-out.

results.title: Robots: the animated docu-soap
results.brief_description:
Just another day in the life of three ordinary robots suffering for their art - Jackson, a painter/sculptor; Roland, a composer/musician; and Hands, a champion skater. This award-winning animated film tracks the demise of the three redundant robots as they attempt to reassert meaning into their empty lives. Made in the style of a documentary-soap and containing a rather dark sense of humour, this is a somewhat offbeat satirical depiction of the genre.
Voice: David Hopewell. (Awards: Best New British Animation, Edinburgh International Film Festival 2000; Jury Award, Art Film Festival 2001)

results.title: Fell
results.brief_description: This experimental puppet animation has an uneasy feel reminiscent of videos made in the 90’s by Tool guitarist Adam Jones. A small wooden figure tries to stand unassisted on trembling limbs as nameless shadows flicker just out of sight. “Fell” was an outstanding contribution to the 2000 Diegesis Program. It is a surreal and beautiful work.

results.title: All ears
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Parker, Sunny McGill, Jeane McGill, Bruce McGill and Ben McGill
results.brief_description: A short claymation about an old man whose quiet ‘memory filled’ days are rudely interrupted by a pushy salesman. As the old man contently potters around his flat faintly hearing the outside world he is bombarded by the overbearing hard-sell tactics of a salesman selling hearing aids.

results.title: Bert
results.brief_description: The state of Bert’s bathroom reflects his personal hygiene, both are totally disgusting. Bert wallows in his squalid ways until one morning the bathroom strikes back, startling him into unlikely action. Beware - Gross out humour a-plenty here

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Apoidea
results.brief_description: Computer animation about the evolution of a lily-like plant species on a watery planet. When the plants burst into bloom a swarm of metallic insects move in to fertilise its flowers. A violent ballet between insect and plant ensues.

results.title: Penguins off the page
results.brief_description: A biology teacher struggles to make his students pay attention to his lesson on different species of penguins. Little does he know that the very penguins he is discussing have come to life on his desktop, providing an amusing performance that brings his words to life. A plasticine animation in a live action classroom.
